alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 6:25PM EDT until July 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL CHESTER, CENTRAL DELAWARE, SOUTHERN MONTGOMERY, AND WESTERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 625 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported flooded roads in Upper Providence Township. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Swarthmore, Narberth, Broomall, Newtown Square, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Drexel Hill, Bryn Mawr, Nether Providence Township, Lima, and Gradyville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 13. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
